author: Oprah Winfrey
content: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.

author: Walter Winchell
content: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.

author: Bob Marley
content: The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for.

author: William Shakespeare
content: A friend is one that knows you as you are, understands where you have been, accepts what you have become, and still, gently allows you to grow.

author: Ed Cunningham
content: Friends are those rare people who ask how we are and then wait to hear the answer.

author: Marlene Dietrich
content: It’s the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter.

author: Jane Austen
content: There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends.

author: Baltasar Gracián
content: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils.

author: Henry Ford
content: My best friend is the one who brings out the best in me.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
content: Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart.

author: Jim Henson
content: There’s not a word yet for old friends who’ve just met.

author: Emily Dickinson
content: My friends are my estate.

author: George Eliot
content: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
content: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.

author: Benjamin Franklin
content: Be slow in choosing a friend, slower in changing.

author: Plato
content: Friends have all things in common.

author: Cicero
content: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.

author: Oscar Wilde
content: True friends stab you in the front.

author: Jean de La Fontaine
content: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.

author: Muhammad Ali
content: Friendship is not something you learn in school. But if you haven’t learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven’t learned anything.

author: Dalai Lama
content: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.

author: Khalil Gibran
content: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.

author: Louisa May Alcott
content: Stay is a charming word in a friend’s vocabulary.

author: A.A. Milne
content: A day without a friend is like a pot without a single drop of honey left inside.

author: Tennessee Williams
content: Life is partly what we make it, and partly what it is made by the friends we choose.
